p: It was previously described that influenza virus could induce intestinal injuries even after intranasal injection [ 25, 26]. One could hypothesize that L. paracasei-induced health improvement could be due to a local protection from influenza-induced intestinal damages. Nevertheless, in our model, no histological lesions were evidenced in the small intestines of influenza-infected mice compared to control Balb/c mice fed with PBS. However, the viral strain and host genetic background could be important pathogenic factors [ 25, 26].
